inn1.comm: On the target, around off stump, dabbed to third man for a single
on a length, around middle and leg, Hayden punches it through wide midwicket region for two runs
again on that middle and leg, curves in slightly, turned to square-leg
angling away from Hayden who lets it go through to the 'keeper
leans forward, pushes a length-delivery, on the middle and off to mid-off

There he goes. Hayden decides to impose himself. That trademark walk down the track, the bowler invariably bowls it short and he heaves it over wide mid-on. Head still and arms going through the line.

Gilchrist is gone! Caught at third man. Short and wide, he has biffed them for sixes before, he goes back and across, frees his arms and it flies off a thick edge straight to Mark Gillespie. Franklin has a sheepish smile on him.
Lollypop down the leg side - short  and Ponting slaps it to fine leg boundary
beauty. Fuller, on a length, around off and middle, Ponting lunges forward and the ball leaves him.
length-delivery on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket
leans forward, pushed a length-delivery to the on side
lovely probing delivery, angling away from the off stump line, Ponting lunges forward in his characteristic fashion and shoulders arms.
around the off stump line, on a length, steered to point
short and outside off, cut to third man
It was short and bang.  Ponting swivels and pulls it in front of square. The best puller in World Cricket.
shout for lbw. Fuller, on the middle and leg, angling in, Ponting, as his wont, gets his front leg across and has to play around it, misses and it thuds into the pad. But it was going down leg side
similar delivery, Ponting puts bat to ball this time, flicks it past square-leg for a single
Another single past square-leg. They are trying to get him lbw but straying a bit too much to the legs.
full-pitched outside off stump, driven to cover
almost chopped on. Slightly short in length, just outside the off stump, Hayden thought about leaving it initially, then had a poke and gets a inside edge.
Hayden rings the room service and Franklin serves one short and wide, slapped past point.

Chesters, you have to wait for that wobble. Another boundary gift-wrapped by the bowler. Overpitched outside off stump and creamed through cover region. He leant on to that nicely, head over the ball and the right-elbow high.
Around the off stump, on a length and Hayden pays respect by shouldering arms
And again.
turns in from outside off, Ponting leans forward, defends solidly
again spins in from outside off, Ponting lunges forward, guides to backward point. Will he charge out now?

Hello? sharp spin there. Turned in from outside off stump, Ponting back to cut and was surprised at the amount of spin and bounce, ends up jabbing it to point. We have a contest. Will he go for the sweep now?
Aha! he goes for the slog sweep. No man at deep midwicket and he went down on his knee and swung it over midwicket. Game on.

beaten. Quicker, straighter, outside off and Ponting tried to crash it through the off side, not the length for it, nor was there any width ( But of course had he pulled it off, I would have praised how he did it so brutally!) and is beaten
full and straight, fastish, defended carefully to the on side
full in length, on the middle stump line, coming with the arm, pushed to mid-on
Outside the off stump line, on a length, Hayden covers the off stump and lets it sail past him
Hayden has a walk down the track. And oh .... he flat-bats a short of length delivery past mid-off. Merv Hughes, who is watching the game, looks pretty happy with the stroke.
Angling away from Ponting who leans forward and lets the ball go through to McCullum
lands on a length, around off and middle, goes on with the angle, Ponting guides it to point
on the middle stump line, from round the stumps, defended on the back foot.
on the off stump line, flat and quick, mistimes a cut to point
nice variation. Flighs this one, above the eye level, and it dips in front of off, driven to long off
outside off stump, slight turn in, he is not ripping it so far this over, driven through extra cover

beaten in the flight but Ponting had the sense to go through with the shot. There was a deep midwicket, no long on and he gets a boundary. Flighted delivery and it dipped rapidly and beat Ponting who was looking to drive. He took the bottom-hand off the handle and went through with the shot and got it over mid-on.
spins in from outside off stump, driven to mid-off
back of length, outside off stump and cut to Styris at deepish point.

Asad Rauf is hurt. Ouch. Hayden drills it straight back at him. Full-pitched, on the middle and Hayden goes for the red.  Bang. Rauf tries to get away but there is no hiding. It thuds into his left arm. He wags his finger at Hayden, in mock threat.
Rauf can breathe easy. Hayden carves this full-pitched one outside off stump through cover point.
slower one, on the middle and leg, pushed to the on side
Another no ball. Rauf screams No, Ponting says yes to the overpitched delivery outside off. He leans forward, square-drives to the point boundary.

Just short of driveable length, outside off stump, pushed to Styris at short cover who turns around and throws down the stumps at non-striker's end. Hayden is inside the crease, may be he was aiming for Rauf
Fours keep coming. In a flood. Fullish, on the middle and leg, Ponting leans forward, on drives it past Vettori at mid-on. And would you believe it , it was another no ball.
short and Ponting pulls it powerfully but Ross Taylor makes a good stop at square-leg
Franklin bowls no ballsand Mason says time for me to bowl wides. From round the stumps and it slips down the leg side.
on the off and middle, defended back to the bowler
Slightly short in length, outside the off stump, Hayden pulls it , the bottom-hand comes off the handle, to deep midwicket
Oh here comes a no ball. On a length, on the off stump line, Ponting opens the bat-face, guides it to third man
It's not a no-ball nor a wide. Minor miracle. On the off stump line, pushed past point for a single
length-delivery, outside off stump, cut to wide third man
slower one, outside off stump, Hayden shows that he can play the touch game as well. Late cuts it to fine third man.

Biffed. Clubbed and the rest of that Batman and Robin comic strip exclamations would fit. Fullish, on the middle stump line, Hayden heaves forward, takes out the front leg from the line and smokes it straight over the bowler's head and it soars over the boundary. Brutal.
starts off with a flat delivery around off stump, cut to deep point
on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
outside off stump, and Hayden goes for a sweep. No wood on the leather though.
nagging line on the middle, on a length, worked to midwicket. Last ball coming up, will he go for it?

faster, arm-ball on the middle stump line, Hayden turns it to midwicket. End of a tight over. The first one without any boundary in it. That is as much a tribute to Vettori as it is a statement on how brutal Australia have been.
on the middle and leg, flicked to square-leg
full and straight, outside off stump, Ponting leans forward, opens the bat-face, guides it to third man region
full in length, outside off stump, Hayden is struck on the pad as he tries to work it to off side. Point of impact was outside off though
lands on the middle, on a length, moves towards middle and off, Hayden stays beside the line, steers it to cover

Only two runs in the last two overs. Hayden backs away to the leg side, Styris keeps it full and straight, on the middle, Hayden tries to slog it across the line, bat-face shuts and the ball rolls over to the on side
tossed-up, slow through the air, Ponting is made to wait and he cuts it to deep cover
on the middle and leg, flatter, Hayden stays back, whips it to deep midwicket
on the middle, comes in with the arm, Ponting leans forward and defends.
full and on the middle and leg, Ponting leans forward, turns it to midwicket.
arm-ball, lands on the off stump line, comes in towards leg, Ponting pushes it out to long-off
Hayden skips down the track nonviolently and eases a fullish ball to long on
back of length, slanting outside off stump, Hayden pulls it to deep midwicket
on the middle stump line, full in length, comes in a touch, worked to midwicket
fullish, slightly slower, on the middle, driven down to long on
on the middle and leg, Hayden wrists it to deep midwicket
on the middle stump line, Ponting waits, flicks it past square-leg
patted to the off side, full ball outside off
slightly wide of off and Ponting cuts it away through the off side field for a single. Slightly short and he latches on
faster on on off, Hayden pushes his front foot forward and drives to long-on for a single
flighted outside off, pushed solidly to the covers for another easy single
continues from around the wicket and fires it on the left-handers off stump, pushed confidently down the ground
full on off and Hayden angles it to long-on for a single
dropped it slightly short outside off to Ponting, punched to long-on for another single. Too easy this. New Zealand need wickets
drifting down leg, Ponting turns it and gets a top-edge to fine leg for a brace. No fielder inside the circle at short fine, otherwise that could have been a chance
defended to the off side, cautious that time

too short and at Styris's pace all Ponting needs to do is wait on the back foot, swivel and beat square leg. It doesn't rise that much after pitching and Ponting just needs to roll his wrists to get a four
pushed to short midwicket, slightly uppish but drops well short of the fielder
driven to long-on for a single
slightly slower, outside off and seaming away, angled away to third man for a single
over the wicket again, Hayden down the track and pushes it wide of mid-on for another single. 100 up, in just the 16th over.
full and swept away to square for a single
short and Hayden simply waits to club it through the off side for a single
faster on off, defended to the off side
flighted ball outside leg and turning in, Ponting tries to work it to the leg side but can only get a leading edge to the off. Good change of pace from Vettori that time
defended to cover, good over from Vettori that time. Time for drinks
around the off stump line, on a length, cut to short third man
fullish, on the middle, driven to long on
another drive down the ground, this time to long off
slips down the leg side, Ponting tries to lap it around the corner, misses and blinds McCullum in the process and it bobs away off McCullum's gloves
Hayden gets his 3rd WC fifty with a dab towards cover point. Ponting rushes across to shake his hands.
slightly short, outside off , cut to point, slight fumble there and they get a single
off cutter, on the off stump line, late cut to backward point and Hayden screams out No! to Ponting.

On the leg side, Ponting leans forward, flicks it past midwicket. Fifty up. Merv Hughes, the selector, is seen clapping. Ponting raises his bat in acknowledgement to the crowd. Another Australian reaches a fifty. Surprise? Not.
full-pitched, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off

well outside the off stump, overpitched, and Hayden decides to thrash it straight down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off. He could have gone the conventional route through cover but then it is Hayden. He needs to bully and intimidate. Fab striker.
another thrash, quite similar delivery and this time he hits straight to cover. May be that's why he went down the ground last time
slow yorker, on the middle stump line, dug out to cover
fullish, on the off stump line, Hayden doesn't thrust his front leg forward, just bends down a touch and square-drives to deep point
slow in the air, outside the off stump, spins away a touch, cut to Vettori at sweeper cover
well outside the off stump, doesn't turn in much, Ponting reaches out, cuts to sweeper cover
fuller, from round the stumps, on the off stump, well-flighted delivery, driven to extra cover
lands outside off, turns in, Ponting goes back, swats it to midwicket
tossed-up, outside off stump, Ponting caresses it down the ground.
arm-ball, outside off stump, Hayden leant back, waiting for the spin so that he can cut it away, sees that the ball is coming in, dabs it away to backward point
length-delivery, outside off, Ponting eases it to widish long-off.
outside the off stump, comes in a touch,  Ponting is again on that front foot, sees the width, opens the bat-face, steers it to third man
on the off stump line, back of length, Hayden stays where he is, punches it past midwicket. Another single.
fullish, on middle and leg, on driven to wide long on. Two more.
full-pitched, on the off stump line, Ponting whips it across to deep midwicket
on a length, around off stump line, Hayden punches it down the ground to long off. Clinical. No risk. And still they get 8 runs in the over.
tossed-up, on the middle and leg, from round the stumps, eased down to long on
spins in from well outside off, Ponting leans back, cuts it to deep cover. Last ten overs, 51 runs.
dabbed to the off side and they rush across for a quick single. McCullum rushes after it, takes his right gloves off and fires in a direct hit. Ponting is home though.
on the leg stump line, full, flicked to long leg
low full-toss, on the middle and leg, driven down the ground.
flighted, outside off, Hayden leans forward and places it well to left of sweeper cover. Two more. Runs keep coming here. Fleming can't find a way to stem the rot.
on the middle and leg, flicked to midwicket region
slightly short of length, slower, on the middle and off, Hayden picks up a single with a firm push to long off.
on the off stump line, on a length, Ponting comes forward and defends solidly.
similar delivery, Ponting tries to work it for a single, by pushing it towards mid-on region but the straight midwicket coems across to stop
Ponting says ok, then i will turn it to your right. Leans forward and whips it to right of midwicket and picks up two.
on the off and middle, jabbed away
slow in the air, lands on the middle and off, turns towards off, dabbed away to the off side.
fuller, on the off stump line, swept to long leg where McMillan fumbles and gives away an extra run

flighted, really slow in the air, Hayden is on the sweep, is made to wait and he takes out the top-hand off the handle, sweeps it to McMillan. No mistake from him this time and the crowd cheer. He smiles.
on the middle stump line, Ponting paddles it away behind square-leg
Another sweep, again it is McMillan. Again the crowd give him the full treatment.

Suddenly, against the run of play, Ponting falls. Tossed-up, full in length, on the off stump line, Ponting skips down the track and whips it, but it goes in the air and Ross Taylor, at midwicket, jumps up to grab it. Ponting was trying to get it past Taylor and ping the cow corner  but he hit it straight at the fielder.
fullish, almost yorker-length, on the off stump line, jabbed back to the bowler
low full-toss, on the off stump line, flat-batted to long off
gets off the mark straightaway with a drive to left of mid-off.
Smoked. Hayden was waiting for the Powerplay and heaves a fullish-delivery on the leg and middle over wide mid-on.
low full-toss, on the middle, drilled down the track, Gillespie gets a hand on it and makes a half-stop
outside the off stump, full in length, Clarke drives to left of mid-off where McMillan makes a diving stop
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
full, on the off stump line, Hayden clears the front foot but the ball is almost yorker-length, and he is not able to get under the ball, still jabs it away to mid-on
leans forward to defend.
nice. Flighted delivery, Clarke leant forward but the ball dipped rapidly in front of him and he adjusted to work it to the on side.
Hayden backs away, Patel hurls if full, on the middle and off, driven straight to Fleming at mid-off
comes down the track and Patel fires it in the block hole, dug out to the on side and Patel makes the stop. Good over from Patel. He varied the pace, flight and the length.
length-delivery, on the off stump line, punched to mid-off
width outside off, full in length and Clarke reaches it and crashes it to cover point.
edged to third man boundary. Again well outside off stump, on a length, Clarke moved towards the line, slashes it.

Three in a row. Clarke is up and running in style. Overpitched, outside off and he leant forward to cream it through extra cover. There was a short extra cover and a cover in place and he pierced the two.
again he lunges forward, it is just short of a driveable length and he pushes it towards cover point
on the middle and leg, fullish, Clarke flicks it to deep midwicket. They run hard and come back for the second run.
full-pitched, Hayden begins to back away and Patel follows him and driven down the ground
flatter, turns in from outside off, Clarke pushes it to right of mid-on. Another single.
again full, on the middle stump line, Hayden takes out the front leg from the line, heaves but the length is such that he is not able to loft it and gets it through widish mid-on
driven straight to mid-off
flighted, on the middle, Clarke comes down the track, the ball dips, flicks to midwicket. Nice bowling.
flatter, pushes that one through, on the off stump line, driven to long on
flicked past square-leg
on the middle stump line, Hayden backs away, but doesn't find room to cut, dabs it to point
backs away and Vettori follows him, can only defend it to the off side
imposing shot that time, down the track and lofted over mid-off for a glorious four. With the power of an ox, he clatters that
take that again! down the track and driven past mid-off for another four. Checked his shot in the last moment but it's racing away.

Blitzer that time. That's the third successive four and the best of the lot, backing away down the track and tonk! Vettori can only show his frustration as Hayden biffs that over his head for another four. It's not Powerplay time but Hayden's power is doing all the playing
driven to long-on for a single. Full on off and Clarke gets his front foot foward and works it away
slightly short outside off, on the back foot and slaps it to long-on for a single. Wanted to get it towards midwicket and is angry with himself
turned away towards square for a brisk single
backs away outside off again and Styris sees him this time, delivers it full and wide outside off.

Too easy. Full on middle and Hayden tees off, in most emphatic fashion. From the middle of the bat the ball soars way, way over wide long-on for a huge six. Cracking them straight and cracking them with the touch of the brutal
cut away to square for a single
tapped away to the off side, can't find the gap
cramped for room but tucked away towards mid-on for a quick single
faster one on middle and off, driven wide of mid-on for a single
low full toss on middle, driven straight to short midwicket
fired in on middle and leg, drives on the front foot for a single to long-on
faster ball on off, defended to the off side, can't pierce the gap
goes for the arm ball, short and wide and Clarke is waiting on the back foot there, cuts it away fiercely past short third man for a four. He plays the spinners beautifully
tucked away to square for a single
leans forward to defend
on the middle and off, driven to long on
slower, outside the off stump, Hayden tries to carve it through the off side but misses

That's it! He reaches his 10th ODI hundred with a drive to long on. Arms held aloft, Clarke rushes to hug him, players are up in the balcony, the crowd cheer, flags are being waved. This is the 100th ton in the history of World Cups. Well done Haydos.
leans forward, tickles a delivery on the middle and leg past square-leg. Time for drinks
on the middle and off, driven to long on
another single with a drive to long on
short of length, arm-ball, outside off stump, punched to deep point for a single
fuller, on the off stump line, Hayden shuffles across, gets close to the line, drives to long on
from round the stumps, drifts in on the middle, straightens, Clarke waits, wrists it to square-leg
slips down the leg side.
Clarke threatens to back away, then gets back in line, Styris is unfazed, bowls full and straight, tucked to square-leg
on the off and middle, offcutter, pushed back to the bowler
fuller, on the middle, flicked away to right of midwicket where Taylor dives to make the stop

Styris takes a beauty, running back towards the 30-yard circle. Off cutter, on the middle and Hayden has a swing across the line and ends up lobbing it high towards long on. The fielder rushes forward from the deep, Styris runs back ,gravity pulls the ball down and Styris reaches, lunges forward to grab it. Fab knock from Hayden.
on the middle stump line, driven to long on
full and outside off stump, right up there, jabbed away to cover
on the off and middle, pushed back to the bowler.
full and outside off, driven straight to extra cover
Clarke backs away, Franklin, from round the stumps, hurls it fuller and on the middle and leg, sliced away to point
again he backs away and carves a low full toss outside off past point
fullish, flicked to square-leg
driven to mid-on
backs away, Styris follows him, cramps him for room and the ball beats the loose drive and rushes between Clarke and the leg stump
fuller, on the legs, Clarke leans across, flicks it fine. Very fine.
full, on a length, on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
on the off stump line, full in length, driven to long on
pushed across Hussey who tries to cut but misses.
attempts a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, outside off stump and Clarke drives to left of mid-off. Easy pickings.
Another boundary. Overpitched on the leg and middle, not the line to bowl and Clarke swings it to deep midwicket

OMG! Clarke shoulders arms and hey presto! the middle stump has gone for a walk. Unbelievable! Comedy of errors. It was a slower one, on the middle, Clarke backed away, raised his bat and then was indecisive what to with the delivery. He just let the bat hang high and watched in horror his own demise. It went through straight, (get the bat down man get the bat down, nope) and kissed the middle stump. Clarke is gone. Bizarre. Watch it on the Youtube.
on the middle stump line, wirsted to midwicket where Taylor does the job
loses control at the point of delivery, sends a full toss way outside off stump, Symonds can't reach it and McCullum, standing up to the stumps, gathers
length-delivery, well outside the off stump, Hayden has a flash and a miss
again well outside the off stump, as if he is giving him some batting practice at clearing rubbish, and Symonds thrashes it to cover boundary.
slower one, off  cutter, outside off stump, Hussey fetches it from there and pulls it to deep midwicket
full and on the off stump, straighter one, driven to midwicket
on the middle and leg, tickled behind square-leg
short and outside off, cut to point. Styris is bowling a slew of off cutters

another off cutter, slightly short in length and outside off stump and Hussey rocks back, pulls it from there to deep midwicket boundary. It was too short and pleaded to be hit. Hussey did the mercy killing.
overpitched, outside off stump, driven to cover
on the off stump line, dabbed to point on the front foot
back of length, comes in from the off stump line, Symonds stays beside the line, opens the bat-face, late cuts it to third man region
slower one, off break, Hussey waits, pats it to backward point region
length-delivery outside off, swatted to long off
full in length, outside off stump, comes in a touch, driven to cover.
slow off cutter, back of length, outside off stump, cut straight to point
fullish, outside off stump, drilled to long off
full, straight, on the middle stump line, Hussey waits, tickles it to short third man region
slower one, dips on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler.
length-delivery, angling in towards leg stump, turned to square-leg. McMillan fires in a direct hit at the non-striker's end, and Aussies take the overthrow on the rebound. 250 up.
full-pitched, another slow off cutter, Hussey eases it to long off
on the middle and leg, punched to midwicket
full and on the off stump line and once again Hussey drives to long off. Can we pick some other place please?!
arm-ball, on the off stump line, Symonds waits and waits, the ball appears to be crashing on the off stump when he condescends to bring the bat down, chops to backward point
on the middle stump line, defleced past midwicket
bit of air, bit of loop, outside off stump, and yep, he drives to long off.
arm-ball, just outside the off stump, Symonds goes back and across, late-cuts it to short third man region. It hit him high on the bat and hence he doesn't get much power behind it.
if its not long off, he will pull it to deep midwicket region. Don't blame him, it was short and he swatted it away

Done in the flight and Mason gets under a swirling delivery at long off. Tossed-up and Symonds charged out but it dipped outside off stump and Symonds reached out and ended up scooping it out high. It swirled as it came down, Mason went left and left, then to right, the ball came down as if its drunk, swaying and swirling and he lunged back to take the catch. Well done.
on the leg and middle, flicked to square-leg
on a length, outside off stump, turns with bounce, Hussey rocks back, cuts past point
leans forward to defend
drives to long on for a single
flatter, went with the arm, from round the stumps, Hussey pats it to point. No chance of a run.
floated from round the stumps, on the middle and off, driven to long on
on the off stump line, goes on with the angle, Hussey leans forward, taps it to short third man region for a single.
short, flat, quick and Watson cuts to deep point
on the off stump line, Hussey leant forward and drove it inside-out past point. He placed it very well at the right pace and picks up two as a reward.
full and straight, on the middle and off, guided to short third man
flighted, slow through the air, on the middle and off stump line, drifting in, Watson leans forward, waits, turns it past midwicket
quickish off spin, on the middle and leg, Watson stays back, wrists it behind square-leg
on the off stump line, driven to cover
beaten. From round the stumps, it lands on the off stump line and spun away, Hussey shaped to swing/slog it away over midwicket, misses.
sweeps it this time, will get a single
flatter, lands outside the off stump, turns in, worked to midwicket
slower - again varies the pace, outside off stump, turns in a touch, Watson is made to wait, pats it to backward point.
single down to long on
Watson shuffles right across the stumps, Vettori slows the pace, floats it on the middle and Watson paddles it away
full and outside off stump, Watson square-drives it to deep point
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
And again. The spinners are bowling very well here. Lovely change of pace.
flatter, on the middle and leg, goes on straight, Hussey turns it past square-leg
charges down the track, takes it on the full, square-drives to sweeper cover
spins in from outside the off stump, Watson shuffles across, whips it past square-leg

from round the stumps, loops  it in full on the middle stump line, Hussey shapes to slog sweep it, the ball grips, spins and he gets a inside edge on to the pad and it rolls away to short third man area
on the off and middle, driven to long on
full and on the middle and leg, at the yorker-length, turned straight to midwicket.
loopy delivery, low full-toss, on middle and off, driven to long on
full and on the middle, keeping it right up there, Watson works it past square-leg
Paddle scoop! Watson shuffles across the sticks, leans forward, laps a full-length delivery behind square-leg
tries to repeat the stroke, doesn't get the elevation though.
Hussey charges out, Gillespie hurls in a slower one, full and outside off, Hussey tries to jab it away to third man, bat meets air, ball goes through to McCullum
full-pitched, around off stump, driven to extra cover.
slower one again, delivered from the back of the hand, on the off stump line, chopped down to short third man
from round the stumps comes a yorker-length delivery, dug out past cover.
Low full-toss, slower one, outside the off stump, Hussey waits, sweeps it over midwicket.
another slower one, another slog sweep attempted but he doesn't connect.  It just kisses past the off stump
Again a slow one. This time full at the blockhole, on the middle, driven to long off
And again the change of the pace. Slow, loopy, on the middle and off, pushed back to the bowler. Actually, it will be a change of pace if he works up the pace. Clever.
appeal for a run out. Driven to midwicket and a direct hit at the non-striker's hand but Watson had grounded his bat in time.
yeah you guessed right. Yet another slow one. Off break,. outside off stump, Hussey waits and waits, drives to long off
The off stump goes for a walk but hold on .. its a no ball. Sorrow for the bowler, joy for Hussey. Hussey backed away and is beaten on the drive by a yorker on the off stump.
length-delivery, angling in on the middle and leg, tries to lap it away, and it rolls of the pad
Whack. Watson takes one step back with his front leg and then thrusts forward, like a baseball hitter, and swing a fullish delivery outside off over cover. Flat and fast. Screaming six.
He goes again, gets a bit too under the delivery and it lands in no man's land beyond cover
Cute. Shuffles across and paddle scoops, laps it over short fine leg. Ala Ashraful. Of course had he missed, I would have written too cute for his own comfort.
Whoosh! Disappears to the midwicket boundary. It was a slower one, ends up as a low full-toss, on the off stump and clubbed over midwicket.

Leading edge to six over long on. Hmm... Gillespie went round the stumps, bowled one fullish, on leg and middle, Watson tried to loft it over wide midwicket, got a leading edge and it flew over the ropes.
backs away, McMillan sends across one of his specials - a slow off break, well outside the off stump and Hussey reaches out, jabs it past point
This is interesting. Yet another slower one, again the batsmen is unable to do much with it, shovelled past midwicket

Not any more. Sends this slower one to long on boundary. Watson waited this time and hit it down the ground. Marshall at long on rushed across to his left and threw in a full length dive but can't reach it. One bounce over the ropes
on the off stump line, late cut to third man
full and outside off stump, slicked past cover

another slow off break, lands outside off stump and turns in. Watson had shuffled across the stumps to play his lap/paddle shot but there is not much pace to work with and he ends up swatting it to short fine leg region
moves outside leg stump and slices a fullish delivery towards deep point. Comes back for the second and hello! its his fifty. Breezy knock.
on the middle and leg, pushed to midwicket for a single. Franklin is bowling from round the stumps
Fools Hussey with a slower one. From over the wicket, full and outside off, Hussey went down his knee and tried to swing it across the line, got a top edge to square-leg.
Up .. up and over long on. Full, from round the stumps, right in the slot and Watson knives through the line.
slower ball, on the leg stump line, Watson retains the strike with a push past square-leg.
The white ball is flying everywhere. This one, the last ball of the innings, has been sucked over cover. He backed to the leg side and smoked a full-pitched one up and over cover.

inn2.comm: starts off in the channel outside off stump, Fulton doesn't like the programming and lets it go past him
And again. Much closer to the off stump this time. The next one should be interesting. I think he will take it away again.
nope. He bends this one back in from middle and leg, it thuds into the pad as Fulton tries to work it to on side and rolls away to square-leg
punched away. Short in length, landed outside off stump, moves away, Fulton stands tall, gets close to the line and forces it away off the back foot, through cover point.
back to regular programming. Whizzes past the off stump, left alone
back of length, outside off stump, angling away, Fulton pushes at it, bat-face shuts and rolls over the leg side
short of length, outside the off stump, Fleming drops his wrists and lets it sail past him. He then practises a cut shot. Hindsight is so wonderful.
fuller, closer to the off stump, Fleming leans forward and shoulders arms at the last minute
kicks up from short of length, on the middle and leg, jabbed away behind square-leg. He took out the bottom-hand of the handle and fended it away
banged in short, lost control at the release, right arm fell over at an awkward angle and the ball slips down leg side. It's Tait. By this time you would have got used to all this.
again banged in short, it whizzes just past the leg stump, Very close to the body and Asad Rauf thinks its too close to call a wide.
fuller, on a length, outside the off stump, goes on straight, left alone
hits the deck short of length, kicks up just below chest, on the middle and leg, Fulton stands on his toes, gets on top of the bounce, tucks it behind square-leg
On the middle and leg, fullish, Fleming leans across, falls over a touch, flicks to square-leg
No falling over this time. He leans across to a full-pitched delivery on middle and leg and picks it up over midwicket. It flies over the ropes. Nonchalantly hit.
leans across, pushes a length-delivery to cover
full and outside off stump, Fleming glides towards the line, drives powerfully to left of mid-off

slightly slower, on the off stump line, short in length and Fulton punches it through covers. All the force was given at the point of impact. The bat came down and he punched on contact. Fisted it through.
banged in short, at the body, on middle and leg, Fulton is caught in a tangle but he adjusts to swipe it away, pulls it away with a bit of top edge to fine leg

edged past second slip. Full in length, slanting away from Fleming who shuffled across, had a flash and it flew past Ponting. It would have gone straight to third slip. Tait is not amused. Bouncer coming up, surely.

gets him with a bouncer. Fleming is not happy. Banged in short, on the middle and off, Fleming tries to pull off the front foot, the ball bounces more than he anticipated, and thudded into his left arm before bobbing away to Ponting at second slip. They go up in appeal and Aleem Dar raises the fatal finger. No wonder Fleming was not happy, it beat the bat and went off the arm.

fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, Taylor tries to flick it, loses balance in the process, falls over a touch and inside-edges it on to the pad. Can we play straight when we are new to the crease please?!
Fires in a 151 k bouncer, ducked under
full-pitched on the middle and leg, flicked to right of Hussey, who is standing at backward square-leg and he dives to make the stop.
full in length, on the middle and off, moves towards off, Fulton leans forward, pats it towards cover. NZ need a further 328 to win
pulled away. Short in length, on the middle and off and Fulton leant back to pull it just behind square.
length-delivery, on the middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
off break, lands on middle and off, moves away towards off, punched past the bowler
121 k delivery, on a length, around middle stump line, moves away towards middle and off, worked towards midwicket
fuller, pushed across Taylor who jumps at it, slices it through point. Clarke gives the chase, pulls it back.

McGrath gets a wicket off his first ball. Wicket no 66 for him in World cups. Banged in short, Taylor is on the front foot, goes for a pull from there and hits straight to midwicket. McGrath is obviously happy. Looks at the batsman, claps before running away towards the catcher.
Another short pitched stuff, even better, just outside off stump, but Styris pulls it in front of square
outside the offstump, goes for a drive but doesn't connect
again outside off, left alone this time
lands on a length, outside off stump, cuts in a touch, Styris lunges forward, it gets big on him and he lets it go through to Gilchrist
crack. Well outside the off stump and Styris frees his arm at the width. It screams through cover.

bottom-edge but it didn't carry to Gilchrist. Just short of the lunging keeper. It was short in length and outside off, Styris pulled it, got a bottom-edge and luckily, for him ie, it fell just short.
full in length, on the off stump, punched to mid-off

edged between Gilchrist and a diving Hayden, who is standing wide at second slip position. Full in length, breaks away as Bracken delivers with a off break action, Fulton goes for a drive on the up and got an outside edge
way outside the off stump, left alone
closer to the off stump, punched to cover
outside the off stump, left alone
off cutter, slower one, 114 k, on the off stump line, guided to point
fullish, well outside off stump, Fulton drives to left of mid-off
full and outside the off stump, Styris glides forward and square-drives past  point. he waited a touch on it to get the placement right. Very well played
And again. On a length, outside the off stump, Styris thrusted his left leg across and punches it on the up past point.
well outside the off stump, on a length, carved away to wide third man
133k, length-delivery, around the off stump, closer this time, left alone
way outside the off stump. Wide. Tait. Are they synonyms?
Whack. Brutal pull. Short in length, just outside the off stump and Fulton swivelled and pulled it in front of the square.
short of length, outside the off stump, holds its line, Fulton goes back and across, slashes it down to third man
Up.. .up and over square-leg and gravity brought it down just before the ropes. Short in length, outside off stump, Styris goes for a pull and gets under it a touch, and ends up skying it high.
fuller, on the middle stump line, driven to wide of mid-on
almost at the yorker-length, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket

No ball called. Asad Rauf gets it wrong. He had some part of the feet planted behind the line. Hmm... short of length, outside off stump, left alone. The back foot also just cleared the return crease.
full-pitched, on the middle and Styris goes down the ground with a pleasing drive past the bowler.
Overpitched outside off and Fulton creams it through cover. He is looking good. No.. Kiwi fans .. I am not woofing him.
on a length, around off stump line, punched to cover
slower, full and on the off and middle, driven to mid-on
banged in short, it rises above waist-high, pulled to deep square-leg. Styris reaches the other end and suggests he should have placed it better.
full in length, on the middle, pushed down the ground. McGrath goes up in appeal for a lbw, but imo the ball hit the bat first.
full in length, outside the offstump line, driven to cover
full in length, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler

That's mighty close. It hit the pad first. Full in length, lands just outside off stump, slants in, Fulton goes for a drive, bat comes outside the line, the ball thuds into the pad in front of off stump. Hmm.. that was hitting the middle. Maybe the umpire Rauf thought it was hitting him outside the off stump.
fullish, on the middle and off, pushedb back to the bowler
Victim no 67 in the World Cups. Styris charged out a length-delivery, had a heave, got a bottom-edge and flies straight to Hayden at short midwicket.
greets McMillan with a yorker. Late in swing as well, on the middle stump line, jabbed away to the on side
McMillan backs away, this is just his second ball. McGrath fires it outside off stump, he reaches it, carves it to point
driven straight to short extra cover, full from McGrath and keeping it tight
backs away again and cuts it to third man for a single. McMillan has arrived as if he's a man on a mission. Daring in every sense
full on middle, turned away to square leg for a single
full and swinging from outside off, driven back to the bowler
short outside off and that's a whistling pull shot from Fulton. Sweeper cleans up in the square leg boundary.

nailed 'em. Full length ball pitching on off and rattling McMillan's pads. It strikes him on middle and, despite Tait delivering from a wide angle, it would have gone on to hit leg stump. Asad Rauf waits for the long appeal to subside before lifting the finger. It's the slowest death of all and McMillan has to go. Tait has struck
short ball and it's pulled away to square for a couple. Not in control of the shot
wide outside off, wayward this time
full ball on off, driven to short extra cover. Can't beat the fielder
defended to covers
on the middle and leg, flicked to short fine leg
lands on the off stump, spins away sharply, pushed to mid-off
fuller, flighted, swept with a bit of inside-edge to behind square-leg
tossed-up, on the middle, flicked past midwicket
slightly short, on the off and middle, worked through midwicket region
short of length, on the off stump line, punched through midwicket

done by the change of pace. Around 111k slower one, full and outside off, Franklin goes for a drive, is early into the stroke, gets a inside-edge and drags on to the stumps. Five down and boy are they wobbling or what?
fullish, outside off, driven to cover. Watson appeals for a lbw, he thinks the ball hit the pad first. He was right but the point of impact was just outside off stump. Asad Rauf gets it right.
way down the leg side.
on the middle and leg, worked through midwicket region
full and outside off, Fulton thrashes it down the ground to McGrath at long on
loopy delivery, dips on the middle, driven to cover point
leans forward, drives to backward point
slightly short and pulled away to left of long leg
low dipping full-toss, outside off stump, Fulton drives, it runs off the bottom half of the bat through point
full in length, outside the off stump, McCullum squaredrives but can't beat Clarke at point who dives to his right
McCullum walks down the track, Watson hits the deck short of length, on the off sutmp line, stabs at it, gets a inside-edge to fine leg
on the off and middle, short of length, Fulton shuffles across, tucks it past square-leg
length-delivery, outside off stump, comes in a touch, McCullum gets across, pushes at it and it hits the pad, but outside the off stump
And again, the ball rolls over towards cover.
on the leg stump line, paddled away to fine leg
on the middle, turns in, clipped to long leg
floated outside off stump, McCullum shapes to nudge it to off side, gets an inside edge as the ball turns in
on the middle and off, dabbed to the off side
tossed up outside off stump and swept away to long leg
And again.
fullish, outside off stump, driven to cover
on the middle stump line, flicked straight to midwicket
slightly slower one, outside off stump, stabbed away to backward point region
slipping on to the pads, glanced away behind square-leg
short of length, outside offstump, punched to point where Symonds fields.

loud shout for a catch at silly point. McCullum charged down the track, Hogg dragged back the length and it spun in with bit of bounce, McCullum tries to tuck ti to on side, misses and it bobs off the thigh pad and Ponting dives to grab it. Hogg appeals but ..
spins down the leg side, tucked to fine leg
McCullum slog sweeps straight to Hussey at deep midwicket. Flighted up, on the off stump line and McCullum tries to sweep it to deep square-leg, instead it flies to deep midwicket.
on the off stump line, dabbed to backward point
short and Vettori pulls it fiercely, almost took out Ponting at short leg, to midwicket boundary
almost fools him with the googly. It landed outside off stump, broke back in, Vettori is cramped for room and ends up jabbing it away
on a length, around off stump, driven to mid-on
leans forward to a length-delivery outside off, punches it through backward point. Fifty up for Fulton. 2nd World cup fifty and the 4th one against Australia
fuller and outside off stump, square-driven to Symonds at cover point
on a length, outside off stump, pushed to cover
bouncer, on the leg and middle line, ducked under
full-pitched outside off stump, driven straight to cover
Another one goes down. Vettori heads for the dressing room. Hogg flighted it, on the off stump line, Vettori goes for a sweep but top-edges it to Symonds at backward square-leg.
turns in from outside off, gets a inside edge on to the pad
tossed-up, outside off, driven to mid-off
huge shout for a catch at short leg. On the middle and leg, Gillespie tries to paddle it away, misses and it bobs of the thigh pad to Ponting under the helmet.
turns in from outside off, Gillespie goes back, nudges it to the off side
on the off stump line, tucked to square-leg
on the off stump line, comes in a touch, punched back to the bowler
Whipped away. Back of length, on the middle and off stump line, Fulton waits for it before whipping to deep midwicket. Very well placed.
length-delivery outside off stump, pushed through the cover region
on the middle and off, turned to right of mid-on where Hogg makes the stop and fires in an throw at non-striker's end. Misses.
spins in from outside off, Fulton goes back, waits for the turn, tucks it behind square-leg
on the middle and leg, clipped to behind square-leg
fuller, on the off stump line, flicked to the on side
shortish, on the leg and middle, lapped around the corner, behind square-leg
googly does the trick. Floated up, on the middle, Gillespie has a slog-sweep across the line and ends up lobbing a dolly to McGrath at mid-on.
down the leg side, spins away, Fulton lets it go past him. Wide called.
slightly short, on the middle and leg, Fulton pulls, in the air, past square-leg. Catch it was Gilchrist's call ..... er... can we get the opposition get a few boundaries at least?
full, 138.7 kph, on the off and middle, dug out back to the bowler
off cutter, on the off and middle, defended back to the bowler
banged in short but it sails down leg side
fuller, on the off stump line, cuts in, driven to mid-off
from wide of the crease, on the middle, turned towards midwicket.
And then they were one. well outside the off stump, full in length, Mason fishes at it and Asad Rauf reckons he got a itsy bitsy teeny weeny nick.
full in length, outside stump, driven to the off side
full and on the stumps, pushed to cover
defended back to Hogg
leans forward, pushes to cover
on the middle and leg, turned to square-leg
Another googly. Another victim. Fulton is the last man to fall. It was flighted outside leg stump, Fulton shaped to paddle it fine, missed and it came back to crash into the stumps.
